pageTitle: Itinerary for Friday, November 24, 2017 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Itinerary for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Friday, November 24, 2017:

Happy Valley-Goose Bay, Newfoundland and Labrador

9:15 a.m. The Prime Minister will attend a breakfast with former students of the Newfoundland and Labrador Residential Schools.

Closed to media

10:30 a.m. The Prime Minister will deliver an apology on behalf of the Government of Canada to former students of the Newfoundland and Labrador Residential Schools.

Lawrence O’Brien Arts Centre
Voisey Drive

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Media should arrive no later than 9:15 a.m.

1 p.m. The Prime Minister will hold a media availability.

Note for media:

  • Media wishing to cover the media availability should gather in the foyer of the Lawrence O’Brien Arts Center for 12:30 p.m.

1:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend a community feast with former students and their families and counsel, elders, health supports, and other officials.

Closed to media

3 p.m. The Prime Minister will participate in a training session with the Junior Canadian Rangers.

Notes for media:

  • Photo opportunity only
  • Media should meet at Canex Supermarket parking lot (381 Banshee Boulevard) no later than 2:15 p.m. Media wishing to cover this event will be escorted via bus to the Junior Canadian Rangers training site.
  • Boots and warm clothing are recommended.

4:45 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend a reception with community leaders.

Closed to media

Note: all times local (AST)

Media appearance

  • A documentary on Newfoundland and Labrador Residential Schools will air on CBC’s The National as of 9 p.m. EST.
